tooltips.shiftRest: Restores all HP, all WP, and removes all conditions
tooltips.passOneShift: Advances time without resting, making rest actions available again

weapons.weaponBroken: {weapon} is broken and cannot be used!

traits.onlyForNpcsMonsters: Traits are only available for NPCs and Monsters

lightTest.notForMonsters: Light tests are not available for monsters

fearTest.notForMonsters: Fear tests are not available for monsters

fearEffect.instruction: If the WIL roll fails, you must roll on the fear table:
fearEffect.noPermission: You do not have permission to roll for this character
fearEffect.tableFailed: Failed to roll fear effect table

severeInjury.tableNotFound: Severe Injury roll table not found
severeInjury.tableFailed: Failed to roll severe injury table
severeInjury.failed: Failed to perform severe injury test
severeInjury.onlyForCharacters: Severe injury tests are only available for characters
severeInjury.noPermission: You don't have permission to roll for this character

deathRoll.methodNotAvailable: Could not perform death roll - sheet method not available

monster.attacksOnlyForMonsters: Monster attacks can only be used by monsters
monster.defendOnlyForMonsters: Monster defend can only be used by monsters
monster.weaponDamageOnlyForMonsters: Monster weapon damage can only be used by monsters

lightTest.title: Light Test
lightTest.note: Note: All light sources burn for up to one shift of time. Roll of 1 always extinguishes the light.

table.afterStretchOrWeapon: After stretch or used as weapon

firstAid.title: First Aid
firstAid.skill: Uses HEALING to save someone at risk of dying
firstAid.target: Target must be at zero HP (dying/unconscious)
firstAid.range: You must be adjacent to target
firstAid.action: Counts as your action for the turn
firstAid.equipment: Without bandages = bane to the roll
firstAid.attempts: Multiple attempts allowed until successful or target dies
firstAid.success: Success = target stops death rolls + recovers [[/roll 1D6]] HP
firstAid.cannotSelfHeal: You cannot save your own life (even if rallied)
firstAid.limitation: Additional healing has no effect once above zero HP (except when resting)

dodge.title: Dodge
dodge.skill: Uses EVADE to avoid incoming attack
dodge.reaction: Dodging uses your action for the turn (replaces your normal turn)
dodge.declaration: Must declare before opponent rolls damage
dodge.roll: Success = no damage, failure = hit normally
dodge.cannotCombine: Cannot parry and dodge the same attack
dodge.successMovement: Success = move up to 2m in any direction (no free attacks triggered)
dodge.monsterAttacks: Monster attacks can be dodged unless specified otherwise

rallySelf.title: Rally Self
rallySelf.skill: Uses WIL to keep fighting despite having zero HP
rallySelf.target: You can use this when you are at zero HP
rallySelf.action: Counts as your action for the turn
rallySelf.success: Success = can act normally but must still make death rolls

rallyOther.title: Rally Other
rallyOther.skill: Uses PERSAUSION to help another keep fighting despite having zero HP
rallyOther.target: Target must be at zero HP
rallyOther.range: You must be within 10m and earshot
rallyOther.action: Counts as your action for the turn
rallyOther.success: Success = target can act normally but must still make death rolls
rallyOther.limitation: Only works on PCs, not NPCs/monsters

deathRoll.title: Death Roll
deathRoll.skill: Uses CON to resist your imminent demise
deathRoll.when: Required when HP reaches zero (each turn until resolved)
deathRoll.roll: A death roll cannot be pushed
deathRoll.incapacitated: You cannot move or act except Rally Self
deathRoll.successCondition: 3 successes = recover [[/roll 1D6]] HP and stop death rolls
deathRoll.additionalDamage: Any damage while at zero HP = automatic failed death roll
deathRoll.combatEnds: Continue rolling after combat ends until resolved
deathRoll.recovery: Failed rolls reset if character survives

pathfinder.title: Pathfinder
pathfinder.skill: Uses BUSHCRAFT roll every shift to navigate
pathfinder.whenNeeded: Required in pathless wilderness terrain (roads/clear paths = no risk)
pathfinder.appointment: Group must designate one pathfinder to lead
pathfinder.spyglass: Spyglass = boon to the BUSHCRAFT roll
pathfinder.noMap: No map = bane to the BUSHCRAFT roll
pathfinder.difficultTerrain: Difficult terrain = additional bane to the roll
pathfinder.failure: Failure = group suffers mishap (roll on mishap table)
pathfinder.dragonBonus: Dragon = double distance covered this shift (shortcut found)

makeCamp.title: Make Camp
makeCamp.skill: Uses BUSHCRAFT roll to find suitable resting place
makeCamp.sleepRequirement: Need one shift per day to avoid sleep deprivation
makeCamp.equipmentPenalty: Without sleeping fur = bane on the roll
makeCamp.failure: Failure = shift doesn't count as sleep or shift rest
makeCamp.tentSharing: Success with tent allows multiple people to use one roll (small tent = 2 people, large tent = 6 people)
makeCamp.tentFailure: If tent setup fails, others can roll separately for same shift
makeCamp.dangerousAreas: Cannot camp in unsafe locations (dungeons, enemy territory)
makeCamp.coldWeather: Cold weather = additional BUSHCRAFT roll (blanket avoids bane, fur grants boon)

hunt.title: Hunting
hunt.skill: Uses HUNTING & FISHING roll to track animals
hunt.equipment: Requires ranged weapon or hunting trap
hunt.twoStep: Two-step process: First roll to track, second roll to kill/trap
hunt.animalTable: Success on tracking = roll on animal table
hunt.killTrap: Second roll using weapon skill to kill or HUNTING & FISHING to trap (some animals cannot be trapped)
hunt.yield: Variable rations based on animal type
hunt.noTravel: Cannot make map progress during hunting shift

fish.title: Fishing
fish.skill: Uses HUNTING & FISHING roll to catch fish
fish.fishingRod: Fishing rod success = [[/roll 1D4]] rations of food
fish.fishingNet: Fishing net success = [[/roll 1D6]] rations of food
fish.noTravel: Cannot make map progress during fishing shift

forage.title: Foraging
forage.skill: Uses BUSHCRAFT roll to seek edible plants
forage.success: Success = find [[/roll 1D3]] rations of edible plants
forage.noTravel: Cannot make map progress during foraging shift

cook.title: Cooking
cook.skill: Uses BUSHCRAFT roll to cook food
cook.rawRisk: Raw meat/fish = disease check vs virulence 10
cook.rawPlants: Raw plants require 2 rations instead of 1 for daily need
cook.capacity: One shift cooks up to 10 rations
cook.fieldKitchen: Field kitchen = boon to cooking roll
cook.properKitchen: Proper kitchen = boon + unlimited cooking capacity
cook.failure: Failure = food remains uncooked with associated risks

showAllSpells.name: Show All Spells
showAllSpells.hint: Show all known spells instead of only prepared spells. Prepared spells will be marked with ⚡

showWeaponSkills.name: Show Weapon Skills
showWeaponSkills.hint: Display weapon skills on the HUD

showSecondarySkills.name: Show Secondary Skills
showSecondarySkills.hint: Display secondary skills on the HUD

showUnequippedItems.name: Show Unequipped Items
showUnequippedItems.hint: Show unequipped armor, helmets, and items on the HUD

showCurrency.name: Show Currency
showCurrency.hint: Display currency (gold, silver, copper) buttons on the HUD

severeInjuryTableUuid.name: Severe Injury Table UUID
severeInjuryTableUuid.hint: UUID of custom Severe Injury table for Token Action HUD rolls only (e.g., RollTable.4wZ2sIWqV3tw8eKL). Leave blank for auto-detection.

fearEffectTableUuid.name: Fear Effect Table UUID
fearEffectTableUuid.hint: UUID of custom Fear effect table for Token Action HUD rolls only (e.g., RollTable.wHTr9HuHkpVv7ccX). Leave blank for auto-detection.

hudAboveWindows.name: Show HUD Above Other Windows
hudAboveWindows.hint: Optional: Force the Token Action HUD to appear above other Foundry elements like Journal entries and character sheets. This is not core Token Action HUD functionality and may cause visual issues in some cases.

buttonBackgroundColor.name: Button Background Color
buttonBackgroundColor.hint: Hex color code for button backgrounds (e.g., #00604d)

buttonBackgroundOpacity.name: Button Background Opacity
buttonBackgroundOpacity.hint: Opacity of button backgrounds (0 = transparent, 1 = solid)

buttonBorderColor.name: Button Border Color
buttonBorderColor.hint: Hex color code for button borders (e.g., #808080)

buttonBorderSize.name: Button Border Size
buttonBorderSize.hint: Width of button borders in pixels (0 = no border, 5 = thick border)

buttonBorderOpacity.name: Button Border Opacity
buttonBorderOpacity.hint: Opacity of button borders (0 = transparent, 1 = solid)
